title: Nigeria cenbank to charge lenders more than $1.3 bln over loan ratios - banking sources
text:
Nigeria's Central Bank Governor Godwin Emefiele speaks during the monthly Monetary Policy Committee meeting in Abuja, Nigeria May 22, 2018. REUTERS/Afolabi Sotunde

LAGOS (Reuters) - Nigeria’s central bank plans to charge 12 banks more than 400 billion naira ($1.3 bln) for failing to meet its minimum loan-to-deposit ratio requirement after a September deadline, three banking sources told Reuters on Thursday.

The banking sources said bank chief executives planned to meet with the banking regulator in Abuja on Thursday to discuss the debit.

($1 = 306.40 naira)
